p: Moreover, Cinnamic and bornyl acetic carboxylic acids were identified by GC/MS in the extract. It was assumed that by adding these acids, to glass ionomer liquids, the degree of cross-linking increases together with polysalt bridge formation and subsequently the mechanical properties of the set cement. This was in accordance with Prentice et al. [ 54], who showed that increasing the concentration of polyacrylic acid with another carboxylic acid considerably reduced the pH, which improves the release of ions from the surface of the glass ionomer powder and increases the rate of cross-linking.
